name: The Ironwood Forest
description: The remnants of an ancient forest that was turned to iron long ago - all that remain is rust-colored sand and large iron spikes that used to be coniferous trees.
places of interest: Drygullet Mine, Brassville, The Sylvan Pools
history: The Ironwood forest was petrified in a cataclysm hundreds of years back.

name: Rusted Canyons
description: A collection of slot canyons that divide the highlands from the plains, created as a result of thousands of years of drainage.
places of interest: The Slag Heap, Churchill Steelworks, Widow's Pass
history: The Rusted Canyons got their name not because of the color of the rock--the rocks are brown, like most everywhere else. Instead, the name came from the blood of people murdered by highwaymen who often stalk the trails.

name: The Astral Sea
description: Outer space, without all of the drawbacks.
history: The Astral Sea is the physical expression of thought, and has existed longer than the concept of time.

name: Knifeback Ridge
description: High-peaked obsidian mountain range, studded with silver mines.
places of interest: Canyon of the Stone Giants, Haven Township, Spirit Lake
history: The sharp shards of obsidian that erupt from the ground here make it difficult to farm the land effectively.

name: The Great City of New Alexandria
description: A great metropolis, preserved though the rest of the world was destroyed.
places of interest: The Holey Warrior Tavern and Gastro Pub, Alexandria Arcane University, Cheapside Parish
history: The only city surviving the great cataclysm, New Alexandria is the center of commerce and industry on the continent.
